briefdescription.para: Number of buffers available for zero copy.
Class factory which returns a PgpCardPtr to a newly created PgpCard object.

detaileddescription.para: The lane and VC fields define the specific PGP lane and virtual channel on that lane that this stream interface will be attached to.

parameterdescription.para: Lane virtual channel to attach to

briefdescription.para: Set timeout for frame transmits in microseconds.

detaileddescription.para: This setting defines how long to wait for the lower level driver to be ready to send data.

Exposed to python as SetTimeout()
timeout
Timeout value in microseconds

By default the PgpCard class attempts to take advantage of the zero copy mode of the lower level driver if supported. In zero copy mode the Frame Buffer objects are mapped directly to the DMA buffers allocated by the kernel. This allows for direct user space access to the memory which the lower level DMA engines uses. When zero copy mode is disabled a memory buffer will be allocated using the Pool class and the DMA data will be coped to or from this buffer.

Exposed to python as setZeroCopyEn()
state
Boolean indicating zero copy mode

simplesect.para: Info object pointer (InfoPtr) containing the PGPCard information
PciStatus object pointer (PciStatusPtr) containing the PCI status
Status object pointer (StatusPtr) for current lane

briefdescription.para: Get evr control for open lane.

simplesect.para: EvrControl object pointer (EvrControlPtr) for current lane

briefdescription.para: Set evr control for open lane.

parameterdescription.para: EvrControl object pointer (EvrControlPtr) with new configuration

briefdescription.para: Get evr status for open lane.

simplesect.para: EvrStatus object pointer (EvrStatusPtr) for current lane

briefdescription.para: Set lane data for open lane.

detaileddescription.para: This class provides a bridge between the Rogue stream interface and the pgpcard target of the AES Stream Drivers device drivers. This bridge allows Rogue Frames to be sent and received to PGPCard boards. This interface will allocate Frame and Buffer objects using memory mapped DMA buffers or from a local memory pool when zero copy mode is disabled or a Frame with is requested with the zero copy flag set to false.
